question: Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.Ê
human: University students have different opinion about their attendance to class. Some students believe that they should be required to attend classes while others believe that it is an optional for the students. According to my opinion, because it is university level of education, students have enough maturity to choose their choice. Therefore, I strongly agree that going to classes should be optional for the students.To begin with, going to classes are sometimes waste of the time. For instance, some lecturers in our university read the same text in the reference books for that particular course module. Further, they didn't explain the contents in order to understand by the students. It was waste of the time. Because the university students have grown up, they have enough ability to read and understand the text book. Moreover, with the modern technology, students can collect more information from different sources. For example, from the Internet, students can read many articles and e-books and can watch video tutorials which provide the information more apparently. However, some lecturers deliver lectures very informative and interesting way. When the students attend that lectures, they can obviously feel that it was very useful and they did not waste their time.Additionally, mostly university has taken whole day for the lectures. Besides, most of the university students are working students in order to manage the expenses during the education time. Students need to work as part time basis. Hence, they have to schedule the lectures time, studying time and working time. At the same time, rather than attending any boring lecturers, students can participate to other activities such as debate competition, swimming meet, Basketball and so forth. From that they can meet other university students and build up the relationships with them. In a nutshell, although few brilliant lecturers deliver more informative lectures, some are boring the students in the class and wasting the students' time. When the students go to university, they have matured mentally and physically. They have enough knowledge to choose what they need to do. Therefore, to make use of time, if the students choose the classes as optional, it would provide more benefits than drawbacks.
llm: The debate surrounding whether university students should be required to attend classes or if attendance should be optional is one that generates diverse opinions. Some advocate for mandatory attendance, arguing that the structure and accountability inherent in required classes foster a disciplined learning environment. Others, however, contend that university students, being adults, should have the autonomy to make their own choices regarding attendance. I align with the latter perspective, believing that university-level education should empower students to take charge of their own learning experience.Firstly, university students possess a level of maturity that allows them to make informed choices about their education. Unlike high school, where attendance policies may play a critical role in the development of younger adolescents, university students are often motivated by their personal and career aspirations. They are capable of evaluating whether attending a specific class is beneficial to them or if they can grasp the material through alternative methods, such as independent research or online resources. Moreover, it is important to recognize that not all classes are equally engaging or valuable. There are instances where attending a lecture may feel like a waste of time, particularly if the content is poorly delivered or not aligned with students' goals. On the other hand, some lecturers possess the ability to captivate their audience and provide insightful, engaging lectures. In such cases, attendance naturally becomes important to students who appreciate the value of learning from these educators.In conclusion, while some people believe that class attendance should be compulsory to instill discipline, I argue that university students should have the option to choose. They are mature enough to assess their educational needs and determine how best to meet them, making optional attendance a more beneficial approach in higher education.

question: Technology makes people's lives simpler rather than makes people's lives more complicated.
human: Believe it or not, nowadays people are always confronted with a problem that whether technology makes their life simpler or not, thus making them confused. Many people advocate that technology makes their life easier. Although I conceded technology may make people's life complicated in some aspects, the convenience it brings is more. In what follows, I will illustrate my point of view.First, when it comes to the field of transportation, there is no doubt that the technology in automobile has made people's life simpler. With a private car, you can reach the destination in another city just sitting in the vehicle. Alternatively, if you would like to have a trip across the ocean, a plane can carry you there in only a few hours, which is hard to imagine in the ancient times.Second, technology also makes teaching simpler. In the past, teachers have to write what they want to convey to students on the chalkboard, resulting in a great waste of time and the fatigue of teachers. With the advent of iPads in e-learning, paper books become unnecessary, so does the blackboards, it is because all the knowledge and information are stored in the iPads, with a single click, and they would appear right before your eyes at once.Admittedly, to some extent, technology may make people's life more complicated. For example, the cell phone, which used to be simply a tool to deliver messages to your contacts in a distance, now are playing a role more than just a phone in social communications. For instance, folks have to check their Facebooks, Twitters, and Forums accounts every minute, which add too much pressure to them. In addition, games on their phone exert a tremendous fascination on teenagers, leading to a large problem that they got addicted to their phones. Consequently, making their life more complicated and tired. Based on the factors I have mentioned above, a conclusion can be drawn that although technology may make people's life complicated in some cases, the convenience it brings in people's are significant.
llm: In today’s fast-paced world, the debate regarding whether technology simplifies or complicates life remains a pertinent topic. Many individuals find themselves grappling with this question, often feeling uncertain about the impact of technological advancements on their daily existence. While it's true that technology has introduced certain complexities, I firmly concede that the convenience and efficiency it brings ultimately outweigh any complications.To illustrate, consider the multitude of tasks that technology has streamlined. Communication has evolved dramatically; with the advent of smartphones and instant messaging apps, staying in touch with loved ones across vast distances has never been easier. This immediacy not only fosters relationships but also allows for quick problem-solving in both personal and professional contexts. Moreover, online platforms enable access to a wealth of information and resources, empowering individuals to educate themselves and make informed decisions rapidly.Furthermore, advancements in technology have revolutionized daily chores, making them less time-consuming. Smart home devices, for instance, can automate tasks ranging from adjusting the thermostat to managing grocery lists, thereby optimizing time management. As a result, people can focus on more meaningful activities rather than getting bogged down by mundane tasks.Nevertheless, it is important to acknowledge that the rapid pace of technological change can lead to feelings of overwhelm. Many individuals may find it challenging to keep up with constant updates and new applications, leading to confusion. However, this complexity is often a temporary hurdle in the face of a larger, beneficial transformation.In conclusion, while technology may introduce certain complications into our lives, its ability to simplify processes, enhance communication, and save time is undeniable. Embracing technology does not mean relinquishing control; rather, it offers an opportunity to harness tools that foster growth and productivity, ultimately making our lives better and more manageable.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television, newspapers, magazines and other media pay to much attention to the personal lives of famous people such as public figures and celebrities. Use specific reasons and details to explain your opinion.
human: Some people think that mass media should only focus on news and current affairs. Others believe that television, newspapers and magazines should keep us entertained and therefore they should pay attention to famous people lives as well. This issue is a controversial one, but in my opinion a closer examination reveals that mass media deal too much with superficial things for different reasons. One reason is that television and newspapers focus on famous peoples' lives in order to increase their audience or readership. Gutter press and Tabloid TV are more and more replacing quality papers or documentaries programs. Thanks to the Internet, we can go online and have access to information from all over the world and therefore mass media don't need any more to keep informed people but their goal is to have enough readers or TV audience. Another reason is that we live in a society where the most important thing is appearance and gossip. Nowadays, unscrupulous paparazzi constantly follow celebrities just to take a photo while they are eating or training. Newspapers often receive accusations of checkbook journalism; this means that magazines pay people a lot of money for stories or photos. Additionally, there are Reality TV, television programs in which people are put into artificial environments and situations, for example like "Big Brother".To sum up, it is clear that television, magazines and newspapers pay too much attention of peoples' private lives for all the reasons mentioned above, namely to increase audience or readership and to give exciting and shocking news to a society which feed upon gutter press and Tabloid TV.
llm: In today's world, it is undeniable that media outlets such as television, newspapers, and magazines allocate an overwhelming amount of attention to the personal lives of celebrities and public figures. I firmly agree with the statement that this focus often veers into the realm of the superficial, driven by multiple factors.First and foremost, media organizations cater to an audience that thrives on the allure of celebrity culture. The fascination with the personal lives of famous individuals serves primarily to boost viewership and readership. Outlets capitalize on high-profile gossip, relationships, and scandals, knowing that such content generates clicks, views, and ultimately revenue. This trend reflects a broader societal fixation on fame and the lifestyles of the rich and famous, often sidelining more pressing issues that demand public interest and discourse.Moreover, the modern age has bred a culture where appearance and superficiality overshadow substance. Social media platforms, in conjunction with traditional media, have cultivated an environment that glorifies the glamorous aspects of life while neglecting the importance of meaningful dialogue surrounding social, political, or economic matters. As a result, the personal lives of celebrities are scrutinized and sensationalized, while significant issues often struggle for a platform. This reflects a warped value system in which gossip takes precedence over critical thinking and informed discussion.In conclusion, the extensive attention that mass media pays to celebrities' personal lives is not only indicative of a superficial societal norm but also a tactic to maintain audience engagement and profitability. As consumers of this media, it is vital that we critically evaluate the information presented to us and advocate for a media landscape that prioritizes depth, relevance, and substantive narratives over mindless gossip.

question: Which do you prefer: staying in one place or moving in search of another place?
human: Some people may prefer to live in different places at different time because of many reasons such as looking for better job, house, community and so on. I prefer to spend my entire live in one place which is my hometown. In my hometown, I have a lot of friends and good relationships, I love the traffic in here, and the environment is wonderful.I was born and grew up in here, a small town. In here, I have a lot of friends, and we usually spend free time to play sports like soccer, basketball and of course we have a lot of fun. Every people in my town have known each others, and we have good relationships. If anyone needs help, his neighbor will help as much as possible. Nowhere else can give me some people like in here.I want to live here because I love the traffic system in here. We have large streets but few cars, so we can move easily to anywhere. Last week, I went to the city center to meet my friends. The traffic in the city was too crowed. I have to wait for an hour to go to my friend house.I also love the environment in here. I have been gone to some places to travel and stay for a short time, and I realize that the environment in some place isn't clean and fresh like my home town. There were a lot of people so the environment can't be keep clean.In conclusion, I strongly feel that staying in one place is better than moving number of places. Moving some places can give to you a lot of experiences but living in one place like your hometown can make you feel comfortable about the traffic, people and of course the environment.
llm: The question of whether to stay in one place or to move in search of new experiences has captivated many. As someone who was born and grew up in a small town, I find myself firmly planted in favor of staying in one place. This preference is rooted in my deep appreciation for the friendships and connections I have fostered over the years, which are integral to my sense of belonging.In my small town, I enjoy a rich tapestry of social relationships that span the years. My friends are not just acquaintances; they are people who have shared pivotal moments of my life with me, who understand my background, and who support me in both good times and challenges. This strong social network provides a sense of security and stability that is hard to replicate in an unfamiliar environment.Additionally, the traffic in our town has a distinct charm. Unlike the chaos of bustling cities, my town's streets are characterized by their familiarity and ease of navigation. I find comfort in the predictable rhythms of the community, where I can walk or bike, reveling in a tranquil pace that allows for reflection and connection with nature. Furthermore, the environment in my town is wonderful. The lush parks, serene landscapes, and welcoming neighbors create a nurturing atmosphere that fosters growth and happiness. The beauty of my surroundings contributes to my overall well-being, making it a perfect backdrop for creating memories and enjoying everyday life.In conclusion, although exploring new places can be thrilling, I strongly feel that the advantages of staying in one place outweigh the allure of transience. My small town is not just my home; it is a sanctuary where relationships flourish and the environment enchants. This makes me value stability and the deep-rooted connections that come with being rooted in one place.

question: Students at universities often have a choice of places to live. They may choose to live in university dormitories, or they may choose to live in apartments in the community. Compare the advantages of living in university housing with the advantages of living in an apartment in the community. Where would you prefer to live? Give reasons for your preference.Ê
human: When it comes to the issue of choosing an accommodation after completion of their high school, most students always get confused between these two options: living in an apartment, or in university dormitories. As far as I am concerned, both choices have their own advantages and disadvantages. On the one hand, living in a dormitory helps students to familiarize themselves with the academic environment of the university. For instance, students can have an opportunity to take part in many kind of extracurricular activities happing around the campus such as attending conversation club, or joining sports club. Students can also have more chance of interaction with their teachers and classmates. In addition, it is easier for students to get help when facing problem such as if students have problem in solving their math question, they can easily ask for help to their roommates, classmates, or teachers. I think living in dormitory is always helpful to students. On the other hand, living off campus prepares students for the real life. For example, students can learn many new things such as how to become responsible, independent, punctual, co-operative compared to living in university dormitories. They are responsible to take care of everything including paying their apartment rent on time, and dealing with the utility bills. In addition, students also have to focus on their study, and try to maintain their grades higher. Furthermore, students also have a chance to know about the community around them. Interacting with the people, and socializing with them prepares students for the life after graduation. From given the evidences, it seems to me that it becomes hard for students to choose between their living options since both living accommodation have its own benefits. If I have to choose, I would definitely choose the second option: living in an apartment. I think that it teaches me everything that I certainly wants to learn in my life because learning all those characteristics would really help me in leading successful life.
llm: Choosing a place to live while attending university significantly influences a student's social life and academic success. Two prevalent options are university dormitories and apartments in the community, each offering distinct advantages. Living in a university dormitory provides students with the opportunity to immerse themselves in the academic environment. It facilitates easier access to classes, libraries, and campus resources, fostering a sense of belonging. Furthermore, dormitories typically encourage social interaction among residents, making it easier to form friendships and collaborate on academic projects. Living closely with peers also promotes community and support, which can be vital during stressful periods such as exam weeks.Conversely, living in an apartment off campus offers students a chance to ease into the realities of adult life. This arrangement encourages independence and responsibility—qualities that are crucial in the workforce. For instance, students must manage their bills, maintain the cleanliness of their space, and cook for themselves. These experiences teach valuable life skills such as budgeting, time management, and cooperation with roommates. Moreover, living outside of university housing often allows for greater flexibility in terms of living arrangements, lifestyle, and personal space.Personally, I would prefer to live in an off-campus apartment. While the social environment of a dormitory is appealing, I believe that the skills and lessons gained from living independently are essential for my future. The experiences of managing daily responsibilities and learning to navigate real-world challenges will prepare me for life after university. Independence fosters personal growth, and I would value the ability to create a living space that reflects my individuality. In summary, while both options have their merits, living in an apartment offers a more comprehensive preparation for life beyond academia.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? In today's world, it is more important to work quickly and risk making mistakes than to work slowly and make sure that everything is correct.
human: Organizations, these days, seek to find people who can work extraordinary fast and carefully. These people play an important role to increase effectiveness of a company. Working fast yet risky has a place near the ideal goal mentioned before. I am totally agrees with the statement for some reasons. Trying to learn skills, working in two places in a week and gaining more tasks are the reasons which take into account as the most important causes of my choice.To begin with, if persons work rapidly, they will have more chance to study. Attending in some classes which try to increase the skills of employees can be considered as an absolutely effective parameter. If people learn how should increase their speed at work by studying, they can stares in their workplace. For example, I have a friend who was working so slowly. He has been threatened by his boss who was going to fire him. My friend went to a course where he learned how should work rapidly and now he is working.Most importantly, people prone to work in two or three firms in a week because the expenses have been increased. If they work just in one organization they cannot earn enough money. This fact pushes them to work faster and faster. For example, because applying to study abroad needs a lot of money, I am working in two organization to gain more salary. The more money, the more chances.Last but not least, people who work slowly can no longer handle more tasks. If you show in your workplace that you are the one who can work more than other even carelessly, your boss will assign you more tasks. If you do them fast too, the first acknowledgement of your boss encourages you to work harder. It turns you to a person who has skill of working without hesitation. Even if we ignore this result, by the same token, you can get higher position and more money.To sum up, I completely approve of the statement which says people should work faster even more risky. Gaining more skills by study, having more than one job, and handling more tasks are the benefits of it which overweighs its disadvantages. I hope people gain this skill because after that they will endorse my choice.
llm: In today’s rapidly evolving world, the debate between the merits of working quickly versus the necessity of caution is increasingly relevant. I firmly believe that in many instances, the ability to work quickly, even at the risk of making mistakes, is more advantageous than moving slowly to ensure absolute correctness. First and foremost, speed allows individuals to adapt and learn more effectively. When one works rapidly, there is a greater opportunity to engage with various tasks and problems, ultimately leading to increased knowledge and skill development. In industries that are fast-paced, such as technology and finance, speed can be the key to staying relevant and competitive. Moreover, the rising cost of living has compelled many people to augment their income by taking on multiple jobs. This trend often necessitates a faster work pace. Individuals who can juggle two or three jobs in a week might face the challenge of managing time efficiently, which requires a certain level of risk in their work. While mistakes are inevitable, having the flexibility to work quickly allows them to meet their financial needs despite the potential errors.Conversely, those who prioritize slow, meticulous work may find themselves struggling to keep up. In an environment where deadlines are tight and the volume of work continues to grow, a slower pace can lead to overwhelm and inability to handle multiple tasks. This can significantly hinder one’s professional development and the ability to adapt to new challenges.In conclusion, while careful and deliberate work is important in certain contexts, the realities of our modern world often necessitate a quicker approach. Embracing speed, despite the inherent risks, can provide the learning opportunities and financial flexibility that are crucial in today’s society. Thus, I advocate for a balanced perspective that values quick, albeit imperfect, work as a practical strategy in overcoming contemporary challenges.

question: Do you agree or disagree: It is not necessary for university students to attend classes as long as they can pass the exam.
human: Though out the last decade, the load of the university students has been constantly increasing. There are those who consider that university students cannot attend any classes until the students pass the exam. There are those who said that student can attend the university coarse without passing the exam. However, from my perspective, students can acquire university knowledge without the prerequisite of passing exam. The reasons to be illustrated are follows. Firstly, the students are not constantly expert in every part of a subject. For example, I love Physics. But I don't like electronics, because electronics cannot always be seen in the real world. And I have had 0 in physics score when I study the electronics. But I constantly achieve 100 score when I study other part of the physics. And if I cannot attend the classes until I pass the exam of electronics, I could not pass the entire part of physics, and I will fail the exam over and over again. Luckily, in our university, you can attend the classes regardless of the score you reach. And I can study physics without consideration of my electronics. And at last, I took the electronics again and pass the exam.Secondly, if the university take the policy that no one can attend the classes without passing exam, students are highly likely to leave uncultivated. If one fail most of the exam, it means that he or she cannot participate in most of the classes. And the students will have nothing to do in the campus. Then he or she will play online games days and nights. The academic achievement will decline. In the end, this student will become a loser in the world. And all this is due to that the university don't permit them to attend the class. This is not the failure of the university but also the entire education system.Admittedly, the university student may don't reach a high if the university allow student to participate in the class no matter whether they pass the test or not. But the benefit of free to access to the classes eclipse the issue of lower points.All in all, the university should allow the student to participate in the classed without passing the test because not only is every students expert in every part of one subject but also it will reduce the student in the campus who leave uncultivated.
llm: The debate over whether university attendance is necessary for students to succeed in their exams has been a contentious one. While it is true that some may advocate for the notion that as long as students can pass the exam, attending classes becomes irrelevant, I strongly disagree with this perspective. My stance is rooted in the belief that true learning and mastery of university knowledge cannot be fully achieved solely through exam preparation.Firstly, no student, regardless of their capabilities or study methods, is an expert in every aspect of a subject. University education is not just a means to obtain a passing grade; it is designed to be a comprehensive learning experience. Each class offers valuable insights, discussions, and interactions that contribute to a deeper understanding of complex topics. By attending classes, students have the opportunity to engage with professors and peers, opening themselves up to different viewpoints and interpretations that aid in their intellectual growth.Furthermore, the classroom environment fosters collaboration and critical thinking, skills that are essential not only for exam success but also for real-world applications. These interactions are instrumental in developing the ability to analyze information and to present it effectively, which are crucial competencies in any professional field. Learning is not merely about rote memorization for exams but rather about cultivating a mindset that embraces inquiry and exploration.In addition, the pressure to pass exams can lead some students to prioritize short-term retention of information over long-term mastery. This approach is counterproductive and can lead to knowledge gaps that may impact their future careers. Thus, the experience of attending classes is integral to a well-rounded education.In conclusion, while passing exams is important, it should not diminish the value of classroom attendance. It is through active participation in university classes that students can truly acquire the knowledge and skills essential for their academic and professional journeys. Therefore, university education should encourage attendance, engagement, and genuine learning above all.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? To improve the quality of education, universities should spend more money in salaries for university professors.  Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: University education is always an important part of one's life. That's why education in university is discussed all the time. What is the best way to orientate the students? Raising the salaries of professors so? I would say no. The professors are essential, however, the schools are established for students. Money should spend on facilities in school or update resources, which are beneficial to school rather than just instructors. The following are my opinions. To begin with, the school should put more emphasis on students instead of professors. I think the most efficient way to improve the education is to guide the students to learn actively. By renewing some facilities in school so students will spend more time at school doing assignment. A comfortable environment can attract people to stay longer. Thus, students spend more time on school to make a good circulation of learning. That is to say, students have a better environment to working on their assignments so the quality of their assignments will improve. Thus, the competition between peers enhances and forms a circulation. In my school, the classrooms in my university are old and kind of shabby. For me, I prefer spending money in a coffee shop to staying at school to finish my assignment. It's unpleasant to stay at school. However, coffee shops are not always quiet, so my classmates and I often finish our work roughly.Besides, the ultimate purpose is to change, to motivate students to be better. To improve education, spending more money to raise professors' salary is inappropriate. In addition, will the university filter all the professors overall? Some professors don't deserve the money at all, then, what's the point to spend money on them? High-salary instructors don't teach students harder because they earn more money. There won't be any effect if school does so. There was news about raising professors' salary in my country. This event provoked a demonstration composing of students mostly. The proposal of the demonstration was eliminating the raising salaries. As you can see, if the policy of raising salary was supported, the demonstration would not happen. At school, students are priority. Students' tuition is not only for the professors but also for their quality of learning at university. That's the main reason I against providing more money to professors. Students are those who suppose to enjoy the use of their tuition.
llm: Education is undeniably a cornerstone of personal and societal development, with university education playing a pivotal role in shaping a student's future. While some argue that increasing salaries for university professors is essential to improving educational quality, I maintain that funds should be allocated to enhancing facilities and updating resources for students. Professors are undoubtedly crucial to the educational process; their knowledge and guidance help shape the minds of future leaders. However, it is essential to recognize that universities exist primarily for the benefit of students. Therefore, the focus should be on enriching the student experience. High salaries for professors may lead to a more comfortable living for them, but if students lack access to modern teaching tools, libraries, laboratories, and updated technology, the core objective of education remains unfulfilled.Investing in facilities means creating an environment where students can thrive. For instance, well-equipped labs can enhance hands-on learning, while updated libraries stocked with the latest research materials can facilitate academic inquiry. Moreover, universities could benefit from improving their campuses, making them more conducive to collaboration and innovation among students. A well-designed learning environment can significantly boost student engagement and satisfaction, ultimately leading to better educational outcomes.Moreover, using funds to provide scholarships or financial aid can have a more pronounced impact on student success. By reducing financial burdens, universities would enable a broader demographic of students to access higher education, promoting diversity and inclusion.In conclusion, while the importance of university professors cannot be overstated, prioritizing their salaries over resources that directly enhance the student experience may not lead to the desired improvements in educational quality. Investing in facilities, technology, and support systems is a more effective strategy for fostering an enriching educational environment that benefits students in a meaningful way.

question: Pets should be treated like family members. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: Pets have always been essential in our society. Cats and dogs are the most common pets but there are birds, tortoises and fishes as well. Some people think that pets should be treated like family members. However, others argue that they are just animals and aren't able to think like us. The issue is controversial but in my opinion, pets should be treated like human beings for different reasons.First, pets are our friends as well as certain human beings are. Similarly to friends, indeed, they are always with us and they are there if we feel alone. We can talk to them because they listen to us, more than some people will ever do. To illustrate this point, I can write about my own experience. When I was 14 years old, my uncle passed away and I felt like everything was no longer important. Talking to my friends was frustrating because none of them have ever felt that way. Since I was all alone at home for a long time, my dog was near me and it seemed to me that only him could understand my deeply feelings. Clearly, although pets aren't able to speak with us, we can nonetheless count on them.Secondly, pets are useful for a variety of things. For example, nowadays the pet therapy is becoming more popular than before. Researchers have discovered that pets can bring benefits in a huge amount of illnesses. There are dogs who lead blind people around the city and therefore without them they could not go around all alone. In addition, pets are important for depressed people as well because their presence make them feel better. Moreover, there are dogs who are educated in order to find out criminals or to use their sense of smell to find drugs. To sum up, I am strongly convinced that pets deserve to be treated like family members because of all the reasons mentioned above, namely they are our friends and they can be useful in many situations.
llm: The debate over whether pets should be treated like family members is a nuanced one, with compelling arguments supporting both sides. However, I firmly agree with the notion that pets deserve to be treated as integral members of our families.Firstly, pets serve as steadfast companions, often providing emotional support in ways that are uniquely profound. They don’t judge us or hold grudges; instead, they listen attentively to our woes, often offering a comforting presence when we need it most. In times of stress or loneliness, the gentle nudge of a pet can feel more understanding than the words of some people. This bond between humans and pets cultivates a sense of loyalty and unconditional love that mirrors familial relationships.Furthermore, the utility of pets extends beyond companionship. The phenomenon of pet therapy has risen substantially in recent years, demonstrating the positive impact animals can have on mental health. Trained therapy animals assist individuals grappling with anxiety, depression, and trauma, providing comfort and a sense of security. This therapeutic bond illustrates that pets contribute significantly to human well-being, akin to how family members support one another during challenging times.Opponents argue that pets, being animals, cannot think or feel like humans do, and therefore they should not be elevated to the status of family members. While it is true that pets may not possess human cognitive abilities, their emotional intelligence and capacity for attachment are indisputable. They exhibit loyalty, affection, and even joy—qualities that are inherently human and deserving of acknowledgment.In conclusion, the argument for treating pets as family members is strongly supported by the emotional connections we share and their invaluable contributions to our mental health. Recognizing the unique relationship between humans and their pets fosters a deeper appreciation for the love and joy these animals bring to our lives.

question: Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
human: Continuous technological and economical development in modern world created great differences between cities, a difference that is clearly visible in the size of various cities. From cities with more that 20 million people to small towns inhabited by only hundreds of people. This diversities in cities allowed for more difference in people's preferences for where to live. For me, I prefer to live in bigger cities than in small ones, this personal attitude is the result of many factors.First of all, I find the excitement of big cities to be attractive, living in a dynamic environment can turn into a very rich experience that sharpens one's personality and open one's eyes on the real world. Life in big cities cities gives one new challenges every day, let it be deciding which restaurant to go to or deciding which company to work for. For me, this lifestyles is very attractive and is considered a huge advantage of big cities compared with the constant, slow paced life styles of small towns.Another thing that put big cities in front of small towns is the facilitates and services it contains which support and improve the quality of its inhabitants' lives, hospitals, advanced medical facilities can satisfy one's need of medical safety. Cultural events such as exhibitions and theatre plays can enrich one's and widen his horizons, things which aren't offered by small towns.Furthermore, it's undeniable that the economic power of a country is driven by it's big cities and the majority of wealth and finance is centered and controlled in big cities. With this kind of power big cities offer more opportunities for one's career advancements and a more chances of higher income that small towns does, and higher income can be the basis of a happier, healthier life.Finally, although I prefer to live in a big city, I can not help but assure that this is a matter of personal taste, to be clear, I would love to spend some days in countryside to recharge my soul and relieve myself from daily stress.
llm: When it comes to choosing between living in a small town or a big city, I prefer the vibrant atmosphere of larger urban environments. This preference stems from several compelling factors that make city life appealing.Firstly, the excitement that a big city offers is hard to resist. Cities are dynamic hubs, constantly teeming with energy and activity. There are always new events, cultures, and experiences awaiting discovery. From art exhibitions and live music to diverse culinary experiences and community festivals, the variety is virtually limitless. For someone like me who thrives on novelty, living in this fast-paced environment can be an incredibly rich experience. The vibrant atmosphere ignites creativity and fosters a sense of adventure, making life feel more engaging.Additionally, big cities tend to provide greater career opportunities and the potential for higher income. The concentration of businesses and industries in urban areas often leads to a more competitive job market, which can result in better advancements for those who are willing to work hard. In a larger city, the diversity of employment options allows individuals to pursue careers in various fields, be it technology, finance, or the arts. Such abundance is typically absent in small towns, where job offerings may be limited, often leading to fewer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Having access to a wider array of potential employers not only enhances the chance of obtaining a desirable job but also fosters a stimulating professional environment.In conclusion, while small towns may offer a sense of tranquility, the excitement and opportunities that big cities provide are far more aligned with my lifestyle and aspirations. The allure of urban life, characterized by its vibrant energy and professional prospects, ultimately makes city living my preferred choice.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is more important for the government to spend money on new buildings than to preserve historic or traditional buildings and homes.
human: The housing shortage is drawing more and more attention nowadays. And the cost of accommodation keeps growing these years. The necessity of governmental financial aid is extremely important. What government should take into consideration at the first place should not be historic and traditional building preservation but new building construction.Building more accommodating constructions meets people's basic need. People cannot live a harmonious life if citizens do not have a decent place to live in. If the price of housing grows continuously, a comfortable place to live in will be a luxury to the middle class and the low class. Then, ordinary people, especially the younger generation, will fall into a certain pattern - work, pay bills for housing, work; and I am sure that it will increase people's dissatisfaction of the government. Because when they are working, the fair of losing their accommodation always lingers, which will limit their efficiency. And government should spend money on people to rescue them from this, because only a government of the people, by the people, for the people will finally last; people's cohesiveness will be promoted.Otherwise, another vital reason why new building construction deserves more governmental investment lies in the fact that it requires far more resource compare to old building preservation. Build a new building has following prerequisites, land that has been sold by the government via formal procedures, a reliable construction company and tremendous amount of labor. Except these, hundreds of problems would occur during the construction. Thus, only government can cope with it by utilizing its enormous resource like dollars and effectiveness. Generally, personally speaking, I believe new building construction hold the right to gain more money from government.
llm: In contemporary society, the question of whether government funds should prioritize new building construction over the preservation of historic or traditional buildings prompts a robust debate. While preserving our cultural heritage is significant, I argue that it is more imperative for governments to channel funds into new constructions that meet the basic needs of the populace.First and foremost, the primary responsibility of any government is to ensure the well-being of its citizens. Modern life necessitates secure, functional, and accommodating homes. As urban populations continue to grow, the demand for adequate housing rises substantially. Investing in the construction of new buildings directly addresses this pressing need, providing people with safe shelters that foster harmonious living conditions. Without sufficient access to decent housing, a community's social fabric can fray, leading to increased poverty, homelessness, and societal discord.Additionally, prioritizing new building projects can also lead to economic growth. New construction creates jobs, stimulates local economies, and can even enhance the city's infrastructure. By developing modern facilities, governments can draw in investment, boost tourism, and improve public services, thus contributing to the overall prosperity of the community.Although the preservation of historic or traditional buildings carries undeniable value in maintaining cultural identity and heritage, it should not overshadow the immediate and pressing needs of the population. Governments can find a balance between both priorities, but the current reality suggests that the urgent need for functional living spaces should take precedence.In conclusion, while historic preservation holds importance, it is crucial for governments to focus first on new building constructions. By addressing the fundamental need for housing, they ensure that citizens can lead fulfilling, harmonious lives, thereby fostering a stable and thriving society.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Most experiences in our lives that seemed difficult at the time become valuable lessons for the future. Use reasons and specific examples to support our answer.
human: I agree with the statement that our life seems tough at the time but those difficult experiences of life become important lessons for the future. My opinion based on the reasons that Every tough experience makes us more skilled, improves our decision making and makes us more compatible for life.The best example of it is how babies learn about basics survival habits during their childhood. Every day comes with new challenges for them like walking, eating, etc., but those challenges of their initial life teach them important survival lessons which help them for whole life. For example, when they tried to learn walking, they stumble and hurt themselves many times. But they slowly tune their technique and learned to walk.All inventions and experiments are based on many unfortunate observations. No known scientist has success in first attempt. Scientists try and test many specimens before they get they want. It was said that Thomas Edison tested around 10000 bulbs before inventing Light bulb. So, all the initial experiments would be difficult and frustrating for him but he searched for more options and learnt new findings with each experiment even when he was failing in his attempts and finally found break through.Our difficult experiences also make us robust and strong unknowingly. We might be facing a toughest time of life at the time, but when we think back about those moments later in life, we feel more confident about our decisions and about ourselves. When I moved to college hostel after school, first few days were very unsettling for me because first time I was away from parent and staying with people I had not known. I had felt very fragile and emotionally distracted, but then slowly I started adjusting with roommates and built connection with them. I also became more casual and social with others, this experience increased my communication skill and social speaking skills. Therefore, to conclude my opinion on this statement, I want to mentioned that every experience in life whether it is good or bad always gives us something to learn and keep for life. Good experiences give us good memories and bad ones teach us lessons for life.
llm: I firmly agree with the statement that many experiences in our lives, which initially seem difficult, eventually transform into invaluable lessons for the future. Difficulties serve as catalysts for growth and skill development, shaping us into more resilient individuals.One reason I hold this belief is that every challenging experience enhances our skill set and improves our decision-making abilities. For instance, consider the process of learning to ride a bicycle. Initially, falling and scraping knees can be disheartening and painful, yet these very struggles teach the importance of balance and coordination. As a child learns to navigate these obstacles, they gain confidence and a sense of accomplishment. Similarly, in adulthood, facing challenges in a job or personal relationships often forces us to develop new strategies and problem-solving skills. These trials yield wisdom that can guide future decisions, ultimately enriching our lives.Moreover, difficult experiences fortify us unknowingly, making us robust and strong. For example, individuals who have faced significant hardships, such as loss or failure, often emerge with a deeper understanding of their own resilience. This newfound strength can lead to a greater appreciation of life and a more profound empathy for others in similar situations. I witnessed this firsthand when a close friend experienced setbacks in his career. While initially devastated, he used the experience to reevaluate his goals and aspirations. Ultimately, he found a path that was more aligned with his true interests, illustrating how adversity can lead to personal growth.In conclusion, the challenges we encounter often appear daunting at first, but they serve as essential building blocks for our future. By enhancing our skills and making us more resilient, these experiences ultimately contribute to our overall development. Embracing the lessons learned from our difficulties equips us to navigate the complexities of life with greater confidence and understanding.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Drivers have to pay a fee for driving in busy city streets when there is a great amount of traffic.
human: Started in the late eighteenth century, the industrialization and urbanization witnessed the explosion in number of automobiles. The very fuel that they rely on, oil, has now become the dominant pollution of cities' environment. While critics castigating about the exorbitant use of oil and other insisting to charged drivers with extra fee during the rush hours for their selfish conducts, I hold the contention that no additional payment should be charged on them. The reasons are the followings. Capitalism enfranchised people's right to own properties, and consequently, their rights to use them. Driving cars during the rush hours might is bound to polluting cities's environment, but laws protect drivers to do so, and accordingly, charging them extra fee might seems to be out of the jurisdiction. From another point of view, traffic jam is a natural phenomenon that nobody is able to shun or ban; so it is out of drivers' control. Why drivers should pay a fine only for driving their own cars in a particular time? Wars are notorious, but you can't blame the soldiers who are justing fight for their countries.Buying a car spends hundreds of thousand; paying for all sorts of fee takes another several-these are all ready too much for most of the families to bear. Charging drivers one more fee makes no sense and is ridiculous. Majority of the families buy cars simply for a safer and easier conveyance, and charging them too much fee adds a lot to their burden and is actually jeopardizing their rights.Rather than passively forcing drivers to pay another fee, government should instead, be more active on advocating the use of more efficient and environmental-friendly energy or planning out more reasonable and convenient layout that allow people to reach their destinations with less oil. Sometimes traffic jam occur only due to the malfunction of a traffic light, or unreasonable organization of roadways. In these cases, the one who should be charged for a fine is the city planner, not drivers. Simply put, charging drivers fees regardless of the causes of the problems could be ridiculous and even unlawful. In conclusion, "rush hours" are usually not the direct consequence of drivers. Instead, the real causes of traffic jam may fall on various of grounds, and therefore, charging drivers for another fee for this could be unreasonable and irrational.
llm: The proposal to charge drivers a fee for navigating busy city streets during peak hours sparks significant debate. Critics argue that this measure would address the exorbitant use of oil and the environmental impact associated with traffic congestion. They contend that imposing additional fees on drivers would encourage them to reconsider their transportation choices and reduce their carbon footprint. However, I firmly disagree with the idea of implementing such a fee.One of the primary reasons for my opposition is that traffic jams are a natural phenomenon that cannot be entirely controlled or prevented by individual drivers. Various factors contribute to traffic congestion, including road construction, accidents, or simply the sheer volume of vehicles on the road. Charging drivers extra during these peak times seems unjust since they are not solely responsible for the conditions that lead to gridlock. It would be unreasonable to penalize individuals for circumstances largely outside their control.Furthermore, imposing fees could disproportionately affect low-income drivers who may not have the luxury of alternative transportation options. If the primary motivation for charging these fees stems from selfish conduct, as some critics argue, then we must consider that many drivers are simply attempting to fulfill necessary obligations, such as commuting to work or transporting family members. Penalizing them further only serves to exacerbate socioeconomic divides.In conclusion, while the desire to alleviate traffic congestion and encourage environmentally friendly practices is commendable, charging drivers a fee during peak hours is not a viable solution. Traffic congestion is a complex issue arising from various factors beyond individual control. Therefore, rather than imposing fees, we should focus on enhancing public transportation, improving road infrastructure, and promoting alternative modes of travel to address the root causes of traffic congestion effectively.

question: Agree or disagree: one of the best ways that parents can help their teenage children prepare for adult life is to encourage them to take a part-time job.
human: Nowadays, the difference between school and society is bigger and bigger. If students want to get used to the society quickly, it is better for parents to encourage them to take part-time jobs. There are some reasons can support my view.First, there are a few opportunities for students to know how to live adult life in the university. Because most people they contact with are also students. However, when students do part-time jobs, they can work with many kinds of people, and most of whom are adults. So, they can teach students many things about adult life. My friend Lisa, who is doing part-time job now, tells me that it is fabulous to take it. Through part-time job, she makes friends with different kinds of people and they let her know the different aspects of adult life. For example, Lisa thought in adult life, work is the core; but after she knows these friends, she changes her mind that the true core for the adult life is responsibility but not work. Hence, thanks to the information her new friends has provided; now she is more confidence about her future adult life. Second, parents always tell students that the adult life is much tenser than school life. However, because we do not experience it, it is very difficult for us to really know how tense the adult life can be. Therefore, we need part-time job to teach us how hard the real adult life can be. Actually, some questionnaires indicate that if students have taken part-time jobs, they will make the best use of their time to prepare their future and more importantly; they will not expect too much for their future than students who have not taken the part-time job. Therefore, the part-time job can make people understand future life better.Third, some parents are afraid that the part-time job will effect student' study. Actually, most students will do the part-time job in their holiday, so it will not effect on their study. Compared with playing computers every day, doing part-time jobs is the best choice for students to spend their holiday.In conclusion, taking the part-time job can let students experience the real adult life and know more about it. Therefore, parents should encourage students to take the part-time job.
llm: One of the best ways that parents can help their teenage children prepare for adult life is indeed by encouraging them to take on a part-time job. This experience can be invaluable, providing teenagers with real-world exposure that school cannot fully replicate. As parents often point out, adult life comes with its own sets of challenges, responsibilities, and stresses that differ significantly from the relative ease of school life. However, without firsthand experience, teenagers may find it difficult to truly understand these pressures.Taking a part-time job allows teenagers to step outside their comfort zones and engage with the realities of adult life. They learn essential skills such as time management, teamwork, and communication, which are crucial in any professional setting. Moreover, holding a job teaches them the concept of financial responsibility, helping them to understand the value of money and the importance of budgeting. This practical knowledge can immensely benefit them later as they navigate their financial independence.In contrast, spending excessive time on activities like playing video games does not foster the same depth of understanding about life’s responsibilities. While gaming can have its benefits, it often becomes a passive way to spend valuable time. By taking on part-time work, teenagers not only utilize their time more effectively, but they also develop a strong work ethic and learn to appreciate the effort that goes into earning money and achieving goals.In conclusion, encouraging teenagers to take part-time jobs is an excellent way for parents to help them prepare for adult life. Such experiences cultivate vital skills and provide a realistic insight into the challenges ahead, making it a far more constructive use of their time compared to idly playing games during holidays. Ultimately, these lessons can significantly ease the transition to adulthood and foster a sense of independence and responsibility.

question: Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Study achievements depend on a range of various factors, one of which is pattern of work you tend to choose while studying. In particular, we may prefer to work either within a team of other students or alone. As for me, I favor the latter because of the following reasons.To begin with, type of temper is one of the reasons that make me to choose individual work instead of team one. Being by nature introvert, I have to spend much time and efforts on adjusting to surroundings and especially new people. Once, when I was working on presentation with strangers, I sat aside and so prepared more than half of work myself instead of making attempts to get acquainted with unknown people. Therefore, my productivity boosts when style of work is appropriate with my type of temper.Furthermore/moreover, working alone allows me to avoid spending time and efforts on many things that are an integral part of teamwork. In other words, I must not divide tasks and duties between team members, share responsibility and benefits, and spend time on teambuilding. These advantages are especially important in situations of shortage of time. About a year ago I was lucky to become a participant of student brainstorming game. To my rivals' surprise, being the only member of my own "team" I gained a victory.In conclusion, from my point of view, type of temper and advantages of individual work are the most persuasive arguments in favor of studying alone.
llm: When it comes to studying, the method one adopts can significantly influence their academic success. Various factors contribute to effective learning, including the environment, personal temperament, and individual study techniques. Personally, I prefer to study in a group rather than alone, and this choice is guided by a few compelling reasons.To begin with, I find that my temperament plays a vital role in my study preferences. I tend to become easily distracted when studying alone; my mind often wanders, leading to procrastination. In contrast, studying with a group helps me stay focused and on track. The shared responsibility in a study group creates a structured environment where everyone contributes, and this dynamic encourages accountability. Knowing that my peers are relying on me motivates me to stay engaged and prepared.Moreover, group study fosters collaborative learning. Different individuals bring varying perspectives and problem-solving approaches to the table. When I study with my classmates, I am exposed to diverse viewpoints that enhance my understanding of complex subjects. For instance, during a recent exam preparation session, a peer offered a unique way to approach a challenging math problem, which illuminated a completely new perspective for me. Such collaborative discussions not only deepen my comprehension but also make learning more enjoyable.Additionally, studying in a group can relieve some of the stress associated with preparation. It provides a support system where we can share our uncertainties and encourage one another. This camaraderie alleviates anxiety and fosters a positive atmosphere that is essential for learning.In conclusion, while some may thrive in solitary study environments, I find that group study aligns more with my temperament and enhances my learning experience. The combination of focused accountability, collaborative insights, and emotional support significantly boosts my study achievements. Therefore, I firmly believe that for me, studying with a group is the most effective approach to academic success.

question: Some people prefer to work for themselves or own a business. Others prefer to work for an employer. Would you rather be self-employed, work for someone else, or own a business? Use specific reasons to explain your choice.
human: Most people want to work for an employer, because they want to feel secure about their salary, or feel comfortable about other problems of having own job such as paying tax, worrying about selling, etc. Despite these problems, personally, I would prefer to have my own job. My arguments are listed as follows. First, time is the more valuable thing, which I have in my life. By having my own business, I can manage my own time. I could work whenever I want, or I do not need to give reasons to my boss for a delay. I can arrange time to travel when I would like. In addition, I can work long hours for earning more money. Totally, the most important reason for me to be self-employed is the sense of free. Moreover, earning money is the fundamental reason that why people work. The amount of money is always the most important criterion for everyone to choose a job. If I work for other people, I have to give my ideas to employers cheaply. Therefore, I never have been rich in my life, because my salary is not dramatically changed. In spite of many problems of having own business, I can earn more money based on my creativity and personal ideas. To sum up, in spite of the fact that many people are not eager to work for themselves, I would like to run my own business to control my own time, and to earn more money based on my noble ideas.
llm: The choice between self-employment, working for an employer, or owning a business is a significant decision that shapes one’s professional life. Personally, I would prefer to have my own job. This preference stems from two primary reasons: the value of time and the importance of financial independence.First and foremost, time is the most valuable asset I possess. When I work for myself, I have the flexibility to structure my day as I see fit. This autonomy enables me to allocate time to both my personal and professional pursuits. Living in a fast-paced world, the ability to set my own schedule allows me to maintain a healthy work-life balance, which is often challenging when working for another employer. I can prioritize tasks, take breaks, and engage in activities that energize me, ultimately leading to greater productivity and job satisfaction.Secondly, earning money is indeed a fundamental reason for pursuing a job. The amount of money I make is a critical criterion influencing my choice of work. Being self-employed provides the potential for higher earnings compared to a traditional job, where salaries are often fixed. With my own business or job, I can determine my income based on my effort, skills, and the demand for my services. The prospect of creating value and being rewarded appropriately is a significant motivator for me. Additionally, self-employment presents opportunities for financial growth through reinvestment and innovation, aspects that attract many individuals to entrepreneurship.In conclusion, while there are challenges associated with self-employment and owning a business, I find the advantages compelling. The flexibility of time and the potential for greater financial return align perfectly with my personal and professional aspirations. Thus, in the pursuit of work, I am inclined to carve out my own path rather than conform to the conventional choices of employment.

question: Should a city try to preserve its old, historic buildings or destroy them and replace them with modern buildings? use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: It is important for any city to replace old buildings with new ones, but these revolutions should not include historic buildings. The historic buildings show the history of our ancestors. In addition, they can develop tourism industries by attracting tourists. Historic buildings answer many questions, which are mysterious about our previous ancestors; thereby no one can determine the price of the historic buildings. They show the history of nations and previous generations who lived in the city. They show the lifestyle of people who lived in thousands of years ago. They show us how they survive, or how they defend themselves etc. By investigating about their structures, we can understand how much they knew about the architecture of building. In the other hand, historic buildings are important treasures, which provide an area to learn valuable lessons. Another advantage of historic buildings is their capabilities to attract more tourists to the city. It is interesting for most people to know about the way people live in thousands years ago. Therefore, It is a valuable opportunities for any city having historic buildings to show them to new visitors. Historic building can develop other industries such as restaurants or other food industries and handicrafts shops and so on. These are reasons that why we should preserve historic buildings in the city. They can benefit us financially by developing other industries. Moreover, they are the symbols of our nations, which can show the historical culture of our previous ancestors.
llm: The debate over whether to preserve historic buildings or replace them with modern structures is a contentious one faced by many cities around the world. I firmly believe that cities should invest in preserving their old, historic buildings for several compelling reasons.Firstly, historic buildings are important treasures that serve as tangible connections to our past. They tell stories of the people and cultures who inhabited the area, offering valuable insights into their lifestyles, traditions, and values. For instance, the architectural style of a historic church can reveal religious practices and community priorities from centuries ago. By preserving these structures, we are not just conserving bricks and mortar; we are safeguarding a narrative of human history that provides contemporary society with lessons in resilience, adaptability, and creativity.Furthermore, historic buildings can play a pivotal role in developing tourism industries. Cities known for their preserved architecture often attract visitors seeking authentic experiences and cultural enrichment. For example, cities like Prague, Rome, and Istanbul thrive on their rich historical environments, drawing millions of tourists annually who wish to marvel at their unique heritage. The influx of tourists can stimulate the local economy, creating jobs and supporting small businesses such as restaurants, shops, and guided tours. This economic boost makes a compelling case for preservation over demolition.Additionally, historic buildings often possess architectural features and craftsmanship that are increasingly rare in modern construction. They provide aesthetic value that enhances the character and charm of neighborhoods, differentiating them from uniformly constructed contemporary buildings. Preserving these structures contributes to the uniqueness of a city, fostering community pride and engagement.In conclusion, the preservation of historic buildings should be a priority for cities. They are not only important cultural treasures that educate us about our past, but they also enhance tourism and contribute economically to the community. By maintaining our heritage, we lay a foundation for future generations to appreciate and learn from the significant narratives woven into the very fabric of our society.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Learning is a thing that we do in all of our lives. Getting the best lessons, besides our abilities to self-study, depends on our teachers a lot. There are people who believe that no one else is better than our parents in terms of teachers. I whole-heartedly agree with this opinion because of these following reasons.Firstly, parents are our teachers from the very early time in our life. As we were born, parents taught us from the very little things such as how to smile, how to walk to the ordinary routines such as eating. Moreover, when we grow bigger, they teach us many fairy tales and several important ethic lessons that affect us till the end of our lives.Secondly, at school we study bigger things about sciences and languages, but after school we learn from our parents. In my opinion, we spend most of our time at home with our families than it at school. I think when we leave school, maybe we will forget parts of the lessons we learn at school if we do not experience them in life, but I strongly believe we will never forget what our parents have taught us because we use it every day. For example, I believe I will never forget what my parents told me about how to be grateful to other people who help me.Thirdly, I totally believe parents love their sons or daughters unconditionally. Therefore, even when we grow older, get married and then have our own families with spouses and children, parents always keep watching us and help us to realize which is right and which is wrong in life. For instance, my older brother has got married and lived independently for two years but when he faces difficulties in his work or his life, he comes back to meet our parents and ask for advice.To conclude, I strongly believe that parents are our best teachers.
llm: The statement that "parents are the best teachers" resonates deeply with many individuals who believe that the foundation of learning begins in the home. From the moment we take our first breaths, our parents become our initial guides, teaching us the simplest of skills: how to smile, to crawl, and eventually to walk. These early lessons set the stage for a lifetime of learning and development, illustrating that parental influence is profound and far-reaching.As we grow, parents continue to impart crucial knowledge that goes beyond academic skills. They are often our first instructors in morality, ethics, and social behavior. Through conversations, stories, and personal examples, parents teach us the importance of kindness, honesty, and responsibility. For instance, when a child witnesses their parent helping a neighbor or standing up for a friend, they absorb valuable lessons about compassion and integrity. These teachings can shape a person's character throughout their life.Furthermore, we spend a significant portion of our formative years at home, which allows parents to have a more consistent and impactful role in our education. While schools provide academic lessons, they often cannot replicate the nurturing and supportive environment that a family setting offers. Parents know us intimately—they understand our strengths, weaknesses, and unique learning styles. This knowledge enables them to tailor their teaching methods to suit our individual needs, fostering a love for learning that can last a lifetime.In conclusion, while formal education is undeniably important, I believe parents are the best teachers because they instill critical life skills and values that shape our identities. The lessons learned at home often become the bedrock of our character and influence our decisions long after we leave the nest. Thus, the education we receive from our parents is irreplaceable and enduring.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the statement, in order to succed in doing a new job, the ability to adapt oneself in a new environment is more important than excellent knowledge of this job.
human: With the rapid development of economy, the controversial of good worker's requirement is always in a limelight. A large number of people will say the ability to adapt oneself to a new environment is necessary, because it is the basic communication skill for a new worker. From my perspective, there is only one thing would be beneficial to company, and there is only one way to be an outstanding worker, that is possessing excellent knowledge of this job. That's why I believe that the excellent knowledge of this job will be more significant.Admittedly, the ability to adapt oneself to the new environment has been proven to be part of job. This ability is helpful in communicating with other workmates, cooperating with other workers needs this ability, too. But working alone is a longer-term job than communicating, that is, the ability of adapting oneself to a new environment may be necessary for a fresh worker, but the excellent knowledge of this job will be benefit till one leave. The company will benefit from every worker of excellent knowledge. The core and most profitable technology of an IT company is invented by a worker with excellent computer knowledge, not a worker with outstanding communicating skill. The high reputation and popularity of a company is earned by some brilliant workers in public relation department with excellent skill to propagate this company. So the company will earn more money and reputation from these workers with excellent knowledge. Employees will obtain reward from hard-work pursuing excellent knowledge. Through our whole study life, undergraduate and graduate, we keep learning with the purpose of exerting these knowledge and experience on our job, just like an old Chinese scholar said, the essence of study is utilizing it. After we get a job, the destination of we keep accumulating and collecting knowledge is rooted not in fawn on our manager with the ability to adapt this kind of business culture, but in making us excellent and totally master this job. Finally, we will be rewarded with pride. That's why we can obtain reward from out excellent knowledge.To sum up, I would have to say that although we can use the ability of adapting oneself in a new environment, the excellent knowledge will be of more importance. Because it can not only benefit our employers, but also ourselves will be rewarded.
llm: The debate surrounding the attributes that contribute to success in a new job often boils down to two key abilities: adaptability to a new environment and possessing excellent knowledge of the job. I firmly believe that while the ability to adapt is crucial, the importance of having comprehensive knowledge of the job cannot be overlooked and should not be underestimated.Firstly, the ability to adapt oneself to a new environment is undeniably essential. Navigating a new workplace often involves understanding its culture, dynamics, and the expectations of colleagues and superiors. Adaptable employees can quickly integrate themselves into teams, create positive relationships, and respond effectively to change. These attributes are particularly beneficial in today’s fast-paced job market, where the only constant is change. However, adaptation is just one piece of the puzzle; it serves as a foundation upon which successful job performance is built.On the other hand, possessing excellent knowledge of one’s job cannot be discounted. This expertise not only helps employees perform their tasks effectively but also positions them as invaluable assets to their companies. Knowledgeable workers can drive projects forward, mentor less experienced colleagues, and contribute to the company’s overall success and reputation. While adapting allows for integration, it is the depth of knowledge that sustains performance and fosters innovation in the long run.Moreover, working alone, even for an adaptable employee, can be a slower journey to success than collaborating with others who possess sound knowledge. Teams thrive when they combine both adaptability and expertise. An employee with excellent knowledge can lead initiatives, solve problems efficiently, and ultimately benefit the entire organization.In conclusion, while adaptability is an essential skill in a new job, I argue that excellent knowledge of the job is equally, if not more, important for long-term success. The ideal employee embodies both qualities, ensuring a seamless integration into new environments while delivering high-quality work that fosters growth and development.

question: Some people say that computers have made life easier and more convenient. Other people say that computers have made life more complex and stressful. What is your opinion? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Computers have revolutionized our lifestyle during last century.
